Session-1

1. Create a class name Demo, create a file.


package day13;

import java.io.File;import java.io.IOException;
public class Demo {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
		
		File file=new File("file.txt");
		
		file.createNewFile();
}
}


2. create a class and add file and folder into the project.


package day13;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Project {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		File file =new File("file.txt");
		file.createNewFile();
		
		FileWriter fw=new FileWriter("file.txt");
		fw.write("hlw");
		fw.write("Kaise ho");
           file.close();

	}

}


3. create a class and write the information by using File Writer.


package day13;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Project3 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		FileWriter fw=new FileWriter("file.txt");
		
		bw.write("Hii vinay");
		bw.write("fine");
           
	}

}

4. create a class and write the information by using Buffered Writer.

package day13;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Project3 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		FileWriter fw=new FileWriter("file.txt");
		BufferedWriter bw=new BufferedWriter(fw);
		bw.write("Hii vinay");
		bw.write("fine");
	}

}

5. create a class and write the information by using Print Writer.


package day13;

import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;

public class Project3 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		FileWriter fw=new FileWriter("file.txt");
		PrintWriter bw=new PrintWriter(fw);
		bw.println("Hii vinay");
		bw.println("fine");
	}

}

6. create a class and read the information by using File Reader.

package day13;

import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Project3 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		FileReader fwr=new FileReader("file.txt");
		
		while(fwr.read()!=-1)
		{
		
			char c=(char)(fwr.read());
			System.out.println(c);
		}
	}

}

7. create a class and read the information by using Buffered Reader.

package day13;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class Project3 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		FileReader fwr=new FileReader("file.txt");
		BufferedReader br=new BufferedReader(fwr);
		
		
		while(br.read()!=-1)
		{
			char c=(char)br.read();
			System.out.println(c);
		}
	
	}

}



Session-2


1. create a class ArrayList apply without generics.


package day13;

import java.util.ArrayList;

public class ArrayListEx {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		ArrayList ar=new ArrayList();
		ar.add("Vinay");
		ar.add(null);
		ar.add(123);
		ar.add(ar);
		ar.add(new Integer(23));
		
		System.out.println(ar);
	
	    System.out.println();
	
	for(Object o:ar)        //for each loop
	{
		System.out.println(o);
	}
	
     System.out.println();

     for(int i=0;i<ar.size();i++)       //for loop
     {
    	 System.out.println(ar.get(i));   
     }
	}

}


2.create a class LinkedList apply with generics.


package day13;

import java.util.LinkedList;

public class LinkedListEx {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		LinkedList<Integer> ar=new LinkedList<>();
		ar.add(121);
		ar.add(122);
		ar.add(123);
		ar.add(124);
		ar.add(new Integer(23));
		
		System.out.println(ar);
	
	    System.out.println();
	
	for(Object o:ar)        //for each loop
	{
		System.out.println(o);
	}
	
     System.out.println();

     for(int i=0;i<ar.size();i++)       //for loop
     {
    	 System.out.println(ar.get(i));   
     }
	}

}
